content.title: Agricultural Skill Development Training Programme For Women Farmers And Farmers
content.department: Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation
content.beneficiary: Women Farmers, Male Farmers, and Youth
content.details: The scheme 'Agricultural Skill Development Training Programme for Women Farmers and Farmers' was started by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat. This Scheme is sanctioned under a gender audit programme for more productive varieties and a training-n-education programme for farmers. The programme aims to train selected women farmers, male farmers, and youth in agricultural and allied aspects of the scientific method.
benefits: Selected women farmers, male farmers, and youth have been trained-n-guided in agricultural and allied aspects of the scientific method.
The latest information on agricultural aspects will be provided to the selected applicant under this scheme.
The selected applicants have informed the developing scheme of the state and central levels.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Gujarat State.
The farm families of women farmers, male farmers, and youth are eligible to apply under the scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. To participate in the training, the applicant needs to visit the nearest Farmer Training Centre of the district or contact Village Level Worker (Gram Sevak) and request/collect an application form for the scheme.
documents_required: Government-approved photo ID i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat

faqs.question: When was this scheme started?
faqs.answer: This scheme was started in the year 2012-13.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The farm families of women farmers, male farmers, and youth of Gujarat State are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a general category applicant be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of applicants.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Gujarat State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Gujarat State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, selected women farmers, male farmers, and youth have been trained-n-guided in agricultural and allied aspects of the scientific method.

faqs.question: What kind of information will be shared with the applicant during training?
faqs.answer: The latest information on agricultural aspects and developing schemes of the state & central levels will be provided to the selected applicant under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are Training Activities under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The training activities under the scheme are- Pre-Seasonal Camp (Village Level), Institutional Training Course (Four Days), Training for Youth (Five Days), Sharing Followup Camps (Village Level), Krishimela (Krishi Stalls, Competition, Seminar), In State Educational Inspiration Study Tour (For 7 Days), Out of the Educational Inspiration Study Tour (For 10 Days), International Educational Inspiration Study Tour (For 10 Days), State Level Sharing Workshop.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To participate in the training, the applicant needs to visit the Farmer Training Centre of the district or contact Village Level Worker (Gram Sevak).
